t: Matthew 8
A Man Cleansed
When*p he came down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.
Right away a man with leprosy came up and knelt before him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
Reaching*p out his hand, Jesus touched him, saying, “I*r am*r willing;*r be*r made*r clean.”*r Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

Then Jesus told him, “See*r that*r you*r don’t*r tell*r anyone;*r but*r go,*r show*r yourself*r to*r the*r priest,*r and*r offer*r the*r gift*r that*r Moses*r commanded,*r as*r a*r testimony*r to*r them.”*r
A Centurion’s Faith
When*p he entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, pleading with him,
“Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, in terrible agony.”
He*p said to him, “Am*r I*r to*r come*r and*r heal*r him?”*r
“Lord,”*p the centurion replied, “I am not worthy to have you come under my roof. But just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
For I too am a man under authority, having soldiers under my command. I say to this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
Hearing*p this, Jesus was amazed and said to those following him, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r I*r have*r not*r found*r anyone*r in*r Israel*r with*r so*r great*r a*r faith.*r
I*r tell*r you*r that*r many*r will*r come*r from*r east*r and*r west*r to*r share*r the*r banquet*r with*r Abraham,*r Isaac,*r and*r Jacob*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r
But*r the*r sons*r of*r the*r kingdom*r will*r be*r thrown*r into*r the*r outer*r darkness*r where*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.”*r
Then Jesus told the centurion, “Go.*r As*r you*r have*r believed,*r let*r it*r be*r done*r for*r you.”*r And his servant was healed that very moment.
Healings at Capernaum
Jesus*p went into Peter’s house and saw his mother-in-law lying in bed with a fever.
So he touched her hand, and the fever left her. Then she got up and began to serve him.
When evening came, they brought to him many who were demon-possessed. He drove out the spirits with a word and healed all who were sick,
so that what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled: He*ipn himself*i took*i our*i weaknesses*i and*iln carried*i our*i diseases.*i
The Cost of Following Jesus
When*p Jesus saw a large crowd around him, he gave the order to go to the other side of the sea.
A scribe approached him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
Jesus*p told him, “Foxes*r have*r dens,*r and*r birds*r of*r the*r sky*r have*r nests,*r but*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r no*r place*r to*r lay*r his*r head.”*r
“Lord,”*p another of his disciples said, “first let me go bury my father.”
But*p Jesus told him, “Follow*r me,*r and*r let*r the*r dead*r bury*r their*r own*r dead.”*r
Wind and Waves Obey Jesus
As*p he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.
Suddenly, a violent storm arose on the sea, so that the boat was being swamped by the waves - but Jesus kept sleeping.
So the disciples came and woke him up, saying, “Lord, save us! We’re going to die!”
He*p said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r afraid,*r you*r of*r little*r faith?”*r Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.
The*p men were amazed and asked, “What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the sea obey him!”
Demons Driven Out by Jesus
When*p he had come to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men met him as they came out of the tombs. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.
Suddenly they shouted, “What do you have to do with us, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”
A*p long way off from them, a large herd of pigs was feeding.
“If you drive us out,” the demons begged him, “send us into the herd of pigs.”
“Go!”*rp he told them. So when they had come out, they entered the pigs, and the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the sea and perished in the water.
Then the men who tended them fled. They went into the city and reported everything, especially what had happened to those who were demon-possessed.
At that, the whole town went out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him to leave their region.
